column4: I am trying to run some pgp commands on my ubuntu 10 client.. what package do I need to install so that I can speak pgpk? http://pastebin.ca/1986715
I've always used gpg, is that not an option?
I'm not familiar at all with pgp, but pgpk doesn't seem to be provided for it.  Maybe pgpk is pgp with some option?
hmm.. possible I will check it out
seems like the only binary it provides is /usr/bin/pgpgpg maybe check man pgpgpg
also ubuntu hardy is 8.04, 9.10 is karmic
they're in the control file, though I'm not sure why you need to know them
are you creating an openssh package from scratch instead of patching the existing one for some reason?
ok thanks.. I am a little more used to centOS packaging. this is my first attempt at a debian style package
I did a custom install of openssh-5.6p1 that includes the openssh-LPK patch and am attempting to turn it into an ubuntu package
you should just patch the existing openssh package
but you can upgrade the existing package
there's also #ubuntu-packaging and #ubuntu-motu that can help you with specific questions
excellent stuff thanks for the tip!
